divs: Sighting DetailsI was driving home, headed east, around 8:40pm when I noticed red lights in the sky to the north. At first I thought it was a tower nearby, but remembered it has only one light. When I got to a clearing I saw over 35 red lights, ascending upward and heading west. they seemed to be close together. I couldn't tell if there were any formations as i was trying to get a picture. I didn't hear any sound coming from them. I wondered if they could be chinese lanterns, but thought that would be an awful lot. I didn't see any smoke, but it was dark. And I didn't see anything fall to the ground. They slowly disappeared as i watched, but not all at once. And they seemed to all be going to the same 'place'. I did get pictures and will upload them. Maybe there will be a logical explanation tomorrow? I didn't feel any fear while watching. I was excited. I wish I'd taken more pictures or been more observant, but it was the first time i'd ever seen such a thing. I watched until the last one disappeared. I can't say how long it took altogether. Or how big they were. I drove north at the next cross road, to see if I could see anything else, but all were gone.
Summary: I was driving east around 8:40pm when i noticed red lights to the north, there were over 35, they seemed to be going up and to the west. then disappeared, but not all at once.
trends: There have been no other sightings in Bellevue
This sighting has never been favorited.
